item.title: [SPR-7706] 304 responses should not have non-0 Content-Length
item.description:
ServletWebRequest#checkNotModified will set a 304 response code, but doesn't set the Content-Length header to 0. This leads to exception on WebLogic, which gets all worked up about the fact that there's no response body even though the Content-Length headers claims there is:

<Error> <HTTP> <BEA-101104> <Servlet execution in servlet context "ServletContext@26118573[app:MP24MotorPrototype module:MP24 path:/MP24 spec-version:2.5]" failed, java.net.ProtocolException: Didn't meet stated Content-Length, wrote: '0' bytes instead of stated: '3291' bytes..
java.net.ProtocolException: Didn't meet stated Content-Length, wrote: '0' bytes instead of stated: '3291' bytes.
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletOutputStreamImpl.ensureContentLength(ServletOutputStreamImpl.java:425)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletResponseImpl.ensureContentLength(ServletResponseImpl.java:1451)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletResponseImpl.send(ServletResponseImpl.java:1494)
at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletRequestImpl.run(ServletRequestImpl.java:1441)
at weblogic.work.ExecuteThread.execute(ExecuteThread.java:201)
item.summary: 304 responses should not have non-0 Content-Length

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: And as Arjen helpfully pointed out, the solution is not to set the Content-Length header to 0 but to not set it at all, as the Response MUST NOT contain a body in the first place for a 304. ShallowEtagHeaderFilter will therefore also need to be fixed.

I have encountered this exception and it is really a show-stopper for spring-mvc applications deployed to weblogic.
I have created a filter to set the content-length to 0 for 403 responses as a temporary work-around.
Will this be fixed in a 3.0.x release or in 3.1?

Arjen, since we discussed those but do not seem to have committed an actual fix yet: Could you fix this in trunk since you know exactly what you're doing? I'll care for the backporting to 3.0.6 then...

Juergen

@Tom

This should now be fixed. Can you try a snapshot (as of tonight), to see if it works for you?

Thanks - Arjen
Thanks Arjen, I will try it out this week.

I tried using the 3.1 snapshot (http://s3.amazonaws.com/dist.springframework.org/snapshot/SPR/spring-framework-3.1.0.CI-906.zip) since I did not see a 3.0.6 snapshot, but the 3.1 snapshot does not deploy with my app due to a dependency on the LinkedList.push method (introduced in Java 6) by the AbstractEnvironment class. If so, I will have to wait for a 3.0.6 snapshot build to become available until I can verify that you mods have resolved this issue.
Thanks,
Tom

Tom,

I tried the spring-framework-3.1.0.CI-918 snapshot and it deployed fine (no java 1.6 dependencies). Also the fix you applied resolves this issue in my weblogic 9.2.3 / Java 5 environment (i.e. no more "Content-Length, wrote: '0' bytes ..." exceptions are thrown by weblogic server).
Thanks,
Tom
